Package com.mlt.ml.graph

Class Node

java.lang.Object
com.mlt.ml.graph.Node
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivationNode, BiasNode, BranchNode
public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
Node of a computational graph.

In a forward calculation or pass, a node reads data from the input edges, processes it, and pushes the resulting data to the output edges.

In a backward calculation or pass, a node may read data from the output edges, process it, and optionally push backward data to the input edges.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public abstract java.lang.String getName()
      Returns:
      A suitable name for storage.

    • getUUID

      public java.lang.String getUUID()
      Returns:
      The UUID that uniquely identifies this node.

    • addInputEdge

      public abstract void addInputEdge​(Edge edge)
      Parameters:
      edge - The edge to add. May throw an exception if the operation does not pass the internal validation.

    • addOutputEdge

      public abstract void addOutputEdge​(Edge edge)
      Parameters:
      edge - The edge to add. May throw an exception if the operation does not pass the internal validation.

    • initialize

      public abstract void initialize()
      Eventually initialize the node internal data. This method is called after a new network is built, not when a network is restored.

    • validate

      public abstract void validate()
      Validate the internal node structure. This method is called both when a new network is built or when a network is restored.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the internal noode structure is not valid.

    • forward

      public abstract void forward()
      Generally, request values from input edges, apply node calculations and push values to output edges.

    • backward

      public abstract void backward()
      Generally, request values (deltas) from output edges, apply node calculations (parameters updates) and push results to input edges.

    • pushForward

      protected void pushForward​(double[] values)
      Parameters:
      values - Output values to push to output edges.

    • pushBackward

      protected void pushBackward​(double[] values)
      Parameters:
      values - Input values (deltas) to push to input edges.
